titleStmt.title: Von Bertrand Russell an Ludwig Wittgenstein, 12. 9. 1919
titleStmt.author: Russell, Bertrand

sourceDesc.p: Original im BA. Publiziert (Cambridge Letters, S. 130; WiC, S. 102).

list.item: 2007/06: Conversion from Folio Flat File to XML

div.p: I have written to your publisher, praising your book in the highest terms. I hope the letter will reach him. ‒ I wrote to you a few days ago, to your old address, saying that if I can obtain permission I will come to Holland at Christmas for a week to see you ‒ I can't manage sooner or longer, worse luck. I am very thankful you are free ‒ let me have personal news of your health, experiences etc. as soon as it is possible ‒ Warmest good wishes ‒
